content:
A solution of 180 mg (0.63 mmol) of K3[Cu(CN)4] in 10 mL H2O was added, with gentle stirring to a mixture of 538 mg (1.9 mmol) of (n-Bu)3SnCl and 80 mg (0.63 mmol) of qox in 20 mL acetone under nitrogen atmosphere. Already, after 6 weeks, red needle crystals had resulted. After filtration, washing with small portions of cold H2O and acetone and overnight drying, 49.5 mg (25.3% referred to K3[Cu(CN)4]) of the red needle crystals were obtained. Direct synthesis of 1 at room temperature from K3[Cu(CN)4] and qox in absence of (n-Bu)3SnCl was unsuccessful. Anal. Calc. for 1 (C20H12N8Cu4): C, 38.83; H, 1.94; N, 18.12; Cu, 41.13%. Found: C, 38.69; H, 2.01; N, 18.04; Cu, 40.90%.

Synthesis of [Cu<sub>2</sub>(CN)<sub>2</sub>qaz], <bold>2</bold>

A solution of 90 mg (0.31 mmol) of K3[Cu(CN)4] in 5 mL H2O was added, with gentle stirring, to a mixture of solutions containing 189 mg (0.95 mmol) of Me3SnCl in 5 mL acetonitrile and 40 mg (0.31 mmol) of qaz in 5 mL petroleum ether. After 3 weeks, orange needle crystals had resulted. After filtration, subsequent washing with small portions of water and petroleum ether and overnight drying, about 53.6 mg (56% referred to K3[Cu(CN)4]) of orange needle crystals were obtained. The orange needle crystals were collected to undergo X-ray diffraction measurements. However, although a number of synthesis variations of these crystals were attempted, one would unable to produce crystals pure enough and suitable for X-ray diffraction measurements. Anal. Calc. for 2 (C10H6N4Cu2): C, 38.83; H, 1.94; N, 18.12; Cu, 41.11%. Found: C, 38.91; H, 2.03; N, 17.87; Cu, 41.09%.
clean_text:
A solution of 180 mg (0.63 mmol) of K3[Cu(CN)4] in 10 mL H2O was added, with gentle stirring to a mixture of 538 mg (1.9 mmol) of (n-Bu)3SnCl and 80 mg (0.63 mmol) of qox in 20 mL acetone under nitrogen atmosphere. Already, after 6 weeks, red needle crystals had resulted. After filtration, washing with small portions of cold H2O and acetone and overnight drying, 49.5 mg (25.3% referred to K3[Cu(CN)4]) of the red needle crystals were obtained. Direct synthesis of 1 at room temperature from K3[Cu(CN)4] and qox in absence of (n-Bu)3SnCl was unsuccessful. Anal. Calc. for 1 (C20H12N8Cu4): C, 38.83; H, 1.94; N, 18.12; Cu, 41.13%. Found: C, 38.69; H, 2.01; N, 18.04; Cu, 40.90%.

Synthesis of [Cu2(CN)2qaz], 2

A solution of 90 mg (0.31 mmol) of K3[Cu(CN)4] in 5 mL H2O was added, with gentle stirring, to a mixture of solutions containing 189 mg (0.95 mmol) of Me3SnCl in 5 mL acetonitrile and 40 mg (0.31 mmol) of qaz in 5 mL petroleum ether. After 3 weeks, orange needle crystals had resulted. After filtration, subsequent washing with small portions of water and petroleum ether and overnight drying, about 53.6 mg (56% referred to K3[Cu(CN)4]) of orange needle crystals were obtained. The orange needle crystals were collected to undergo X-ray diffraction measurements. However, although a number of synthesis variations of these crystals were attempted, one would unable to produce crystals pure enough and suitable for X-ray diffraction measurements. Anal. Calc. for 2 (C10H6N4Cu2): C, 38.83; H, 1.94; N, 18.12; Cu, 41.11%. Found: C, 38.91; H, 2.03; N, 17.87; Cu, 41.09%.
